You have received a request for key exchange from
Encryption keys will be stored in RAM. IMPORTANT. After app closing you will lose these keys and you won\'t be able to decrypt incoming and outcoming messages.
Encryption keys will be stored in the internal memory.

TERMS OF USE 
 
1. FUNCTIONAL FEATURES 
1.1. Option encrypts only text messages. Attachments encryption is not available. 
1.2. Option is not available for group and community chats. 
1.3. Encrypted messages can be decrypted only on Phoenix or Phoenix Lite up from 2.8.0 
1.4. In order to start encrypted chat members must pass key exchange. 
1.5. Messages can be decrypted only on device that initialized key exchange. User can't read encrypted messages in other apps/device/browser. 
 
2. ENCRYPTION KEY EXCHANGE 
2.1. In order to exchange keys several service messages must be passed. 
2.2. System messages discreditation don't damage your securit. They execute only delivery role and don't contain encryptions keys in decrypted form. 
2.3. System messages removal doesn't damage your security. 
2.4. Key exchange can be executed infinity times. New messages will be encrypted with new keys, old messages can be encrypted with old keys. 
 
3. KEYS STORAGE 
3.1. Encryption keys are stored locally on device in internal memory or RAM (depends on user choice) 
3.2. In case of keys loss user cannot read encrypted incoming or outcoming messages 
3.3. User will lose keys in following cases: 
- app uninstall 
- app data removal 
- after "Delete keys" option in app settings 
- after app closing 
- after account deletion 
 
4. DENIAL OF RESPONSIBILITY 
4.1. Phoenix app developers are not responsible for user data in case of keys loss or improper usage of this option.
Save the keys to a file phoenixkeys.json in the internal memory
